title: CSS :has pseudo-class introduction
description: The CSS :has() operator is a functional pseudo-class that selects an element if any of the relative selectors passed as an argument match at least one element when anchored against this element 1. It presents a way of selecting a parent element or a previous sibling element with respect to a reference element by taking a relative selector list as an argument 1. The :has() pseudo-class takes on the specificity of the most specific selector in its arguments the same way as :is() and :not() do 1.
